msg: Greg Stein points out that the apr_file_t ** input typemap isn't

author: philip
msg: Don't sleep immediately when updating svn:externals, delay until the
entire operation is complete and only sleep once if required.  This
both enables the r4862 behaviour and avoids the r4684 problem.
timestamp_sleep parameter to be a pointer to an svn_boolean_t.
(handle_externals_desc_change): Set timestamp_sleep member in item baton.
a pointer to an svn_boolean_t.  Sleep only if required by an error or
a NULL timestamp_sleep parameter.  ### Add question about recursive
a pointer to an svn_boolean_t.  Sleep only if required by an error or

author: philip
msg: Disable the r4862 optimisation, it's not always valid.  The problem
case is when the svn:externals "need" a sleep and the main working
copy does not.  This is quick fix so that the client operation is
correct, if slow.  I'm working on a modification that will allow me
sleep for timestamp integrity on svn:externals.

author: brane
msg: Get rid of some signed/unsigned mismatch warnings on Windows.
check_explicit_length, try_explicit_length): Change length parameters from
int to apr_size_t; Adjust all callers and printf formats.

author: philip
msg: Don't sleep when checking out or updating svn:externals.  This saves
about 90 seconds when running the regression tests on my machine.
declarations existed but the functions were not defined.  Now they
have new signatures and are defined.
